documents.name: Privacy Policy
documents.text:
Privacy Policy

Last updated Jul 01, 2023

This privacy policy describes how TorGuard's Mastodon server ("TorGuard", "we", "us") collects, protects, and uses personally identifiable information you may provide on the TorGuard Mastodon website or via its API. The policy also describes the choices available to you regarding our use of your personal information and how you can access and update this information. This policy does not apply to practices of companies that TorGuard does not own or control, or to individuals that TorGuard does not employ or manage.

Information We Collect Basic account information: If you register, you may provide a username, e-mail, and password. You may also provide additional profile information such as a display name, biography, and profile picture and header image, which are always listed publicly.

Public Information: Your list of followers and who you follow is public. When you submit a post, the date and time are stored, as well as the application you used to submit it. Public and unlisted posts are available publicly. Your posts are delivered to your followers, which may result in copies being stored on other servers.

Private Posts: All posts are stored and processed on our server. Followers-only and direct posts are delivered to your followers and mentioned users. Other servers may fail to limit access to these posts to authorized persons, so it's important to review the servers your followers belong to.

Metadata: We record the IP address and browser name you log in from, which are available for your review and revocation in the settings. The latest IP address used is stored for up to 12 months. We may retain server logs which include the IP address of every request to our server.

How We Use Your Information

To provide the core functionality of TorGuard's Mastodon. You can only interact with other people's content and post your own content when you are logged in. To aid in the moderation of the community.

To send you notifications about other people interacting with your content or sending you messages, and to respond to inquiries and/or other requests or questions.

Data Protection

We implement various security measures, such as SSL for your browser session and the API traffic, and hashing your password using a strong one-way algorithm. You may enable two-factor authentication for added security.

Data Retention Policy

We strive to retain server logs containing the IP address of all requests to this server for no more than 90 days. Retain the IP addresses associated with registered users for no more than 12 months.

Cookies

Yes, we use cookies. Cookies are small files that a site transfers to your computer's hard drive to recognize your browser and associate it with your registered account.

Information Disclosure

We do not sell, trade, or transfer your personally identifiable information to outside parties, except for trusted third parties assisting us in our operations, provided they agree to keep this information confidential. Your public content may be downloaded by other servers in the network.

Child Usage

Our services are directed to individuals who are at least 16 years old in the EU or EEA, and at least 13 years old in the USA. Law requirements may differ if the server is in another jurisdiction.
